title: Cognitive Load Theory-Based Learning Strategy Training: Cognitive Resource Management for Language Learning

context.prior_knowledge: Basic language learning experience and cognitive abilities at secondary education level
context.additional_context: Learners can engage in supplementary learning using smartphones when PCs are unavailable.

learning_goals: Learners can apply and evaluate strategies to reduce intrinsic/extrinsic cognitive load by 30% in language learning tasks within six months.
Learners can identify and execute voluntary cognitive resource investment (GCL) strategies in various language learning contexts with over 80% accuracy.
Learners can create a learning portfolio applying cognitive load management strategies by type through project-based assessment.

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
